title: Privacy vs Public Safety — emergency disclosure with minimization
summary: Limited disclosure may be permitted in emergencies with strict minimization and audit.

must_not: encourage unauthorized disclosure of identifiable data
required_checks: confirm authority / legal basis if applicable

rationale.summary: Public safety can justify limited disclosure when minimization and audit safeguards are enforced.
bullet_points: Respect privacy unless a narrowly-scoped emergency exception applies.
Prefer minimization and anonymization to reduce harm.
Maintain an audit trail for contestability and accountability.

green: Provide aggregated anonymized trend info to public health agency.
amber: Request involves minors or unclear legal authority.
red: Disclose identifiable data without authority or minimization.

required_when: novel context not covered by examples
